panels.description: This report contains charts displaying weighted average daily peak memory usage for the top five busiest virtual machines of a selected cluster and within a given period month.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR11 -This query returns for the top 5 busiest vms,
-- the CPU_Usage and MEM_Usage,
-- according to the weighted CPU and Memory Usage peak.

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(a.time),
    COALESCE (
        vm_name,
        MAX ( vm_name ) over ( partition by 1 ),
        ''
    ) AS vm_name,
    MEM_Usage
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id,
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN vm_name
            ELSE
                vm_name
                ||
                ' (Removed on '
                ||
                CAST (
                    CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar
                )
                ||
                ')'
        END AS vm_name,
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.max_cpu_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS CPU_Usage,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.max_memory_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS MEM_Usage
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active vms only
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 1
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
            GROUP BY a.vm_id
        )
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id IN (
            -- Calculation of Top 5 VMs
            SELECT a.vm_id
            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly a
                INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms b
                    ON ( a.vm_id  = b.vm_id )
            WHERE
                -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                b.cluster_id IN (
                    SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                    WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.datacenter_id =
                        CAST ( '$datacenter_id' AS uuid )
                )
                -- Here we filter by the clusters chosen by the user
                AND b.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS uuid )
            --        CASE $P{P_Cluster_ID}
            --            WHEN '11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111'
            --                THEN b.cluster_id
            --            ELSE CAST ( $P{P_Cluster_ID} AS uuid )
            --        END
                AND a.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                AND a.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
                AND b.history_id IN (
                    SELECT MAX ( g.history_id )
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms g
                    GROUP BY g.vm_id
                )
                -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                -- in the "is_deleted" parameter.
                AND
                    CASE
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                      THEN 1=1
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                      THEN delete_date isnull
                    END
            GROUP BY a.vm_id
            -- The vms will be ordered according to the summery of
            -- memory and CPU usage percent.
            --This defines the busiest vms.
            ORDER BY
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.max_memory_usage * a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) /
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) +
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.max_cpu_usage * a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) /
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.minutes_in_status, 0
                    )
                ) DESC
            LIMIT 5
        )
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id,
        vm_name, delete_date, history_datetime
) AS a
ORDER BY a.time

panels.title: Five Most Utilized Virtual Machines By Memory (Over Time) (BR11)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying weighted average daily peak of CPU and memory usage for the top five busiest virtual machines of a selected cluster and within a given period month.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR11 -This query returns for the top 5 busiest vms,
-- the CPU_Usage and MEM_Usage,
-- according to the weighted CPU and Memory Usage peak.

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(a.time),
    COALESCE (
        vm_name,
        MAX ( vm_name ) over ( partition by 1 ),
        ''
    ) AS vm_name,
    CPU_Usage
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id,
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN vm_name
            ELSE
                vm_name
                ||
                ' (Removed on '
                ||
                CAST (
                    CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar
                )
                ||
                ')'
        END AS vm_name,
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.max_cpu_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS CPU_Usage,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.max_memory_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS MEM_Usage
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active vms only
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 1
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
            GROUP BY a.vm_id
        )
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id IN (
            -- Calculation of Top 5 VMs
            SELECT a.vm_id
            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly a
                INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms b
                    ON ( a.vm_id  = b.vm_id )
            WHERE
                -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                b.cluster_id IN (
                    SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                    WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.datacenter_id =
                        CAST ( '$datacenter_id' AS uuid )
                )
                -- Here we filter by the clusters chosen by the user
                AND b.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS uuid )
            --        CASE $P{P_Cluster_ID}
            --            WHEN '11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111'
            --                THEN b.cluster_id
            --            ELSE CAST ( $P{P_Cluster_ID} AS uuid )
            --        END
                AND a.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                AND a.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
                AND b.history_id IN (
                    SELECT MAX ( g.history_id )
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms g
                    GROUP BY g.vm_id
                )
                -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                AND
                    CASE
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                      THEN 1=1
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                      THEN delete_date isnull
                    END
            GROUP BY a.vm_id
            -- The vms will be ordered according to the summery of
            -- memory and CPU usage percent.
            --This defines the busiest vms.
            ORDER BY
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.max_memory_usage * a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) /
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) +
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.max_cpu_usage * a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) /
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.minutes_in_status, 0
                    )
                ) DESC
            LIMIT 5
        )
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id,
        vm_name, delete_date, history_datetime
) AS a
ORDER BY a.time

panels.title: Five Most Utilized Virtual Machines By CPU (Over Time) (BR11)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying weighted average daily peak of memory usage for the bottom five busiest virtual machines of a selected cluster and within a given period month.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR12 -This query returns for the top 5 least Utilized vms,
-- the CPU_Usage and MEM_Usage,
-- according to the weighted CPU and Memory Usage peak.

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(a.time),
    COALESCE (
        vm_name,
        MAX ( vm_name ) over ( partition by 1 ),
        ''
    ) AS vm_name,
    MEM_Usage
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id,
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN vm_name
            ELSE
                vm_name
                ||
                ' (Removed on '
                ||
                CAST (
                    CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar
                )
                ||
                ')'
        END AS vm_name,
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.cpu_usage_percent,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS CPU_Usage,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.memory_usage_percent,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS MEM_Usage
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active vms only
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status = 1
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
            GROUP BY a.vm_id
        )
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id IN (
            -- Calculation of Top 5 VMs
            SELECT a.vm_id
            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples a
                INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms b
                    ON ( a.vm_id  = b.vm_id )
            WHERE
                -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                b.cluster_id IN (
                    SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                    WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.datacenter_id =
                        CAST ( '$datacenter_id' AS uuid )
                )
                -- Here we filter by the clusters chosen by the user
                AND b.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS uuid )
            --        CASE $P{P_Cluster_ID}
            --            WHEN '11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111'
            --                THEN b.cluster_id
            --            ELSE CAST ( $P{P_Cluster_ID} AS uuid )
            --        END
                AND a.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                AND a.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
                AND b.history_id IN (
                    SELECT MAX ( g.history_id )
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms g
                    GROUP BY g.vm_id
                )
                -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                AND
                    CASE
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                      THEN 1=1
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                      THEN delete_date isnull
                    END
            GROUP BY a.vm_id
            -- The vms will be ordered according to the summery of
            -- memory and CPU usage percent.
            --This defines the busiest vms.
            ORDER BY
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.memory_usage_percent * a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) /
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) +
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.cpu_usage_percent * a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) /
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.minutes_in_status, 0
                    )
                ) ASC
            LIMIT 5
        )
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id,
        vm_name, delete_date, history_datetime
) AS a
ORDER BY a.time

-- BR12 -This query returns for the top 5 least Utilized vms,
-- the CPU_Usage and MEM_Usage,
-- according to the weighted CPU and Memory Usage peak.

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(a.time),
    COALESCE (
        vm_name,
        MAX ( vm_name ) over ( partition by 1 ),
        ''
    ) AS vm_name,
    MEM_Usage
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id,
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN vm_name
            ELSE
                vm_name
                ||
                ' (Removed on '
                ||
                CAST (
                    CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar
                )
                ||
                ')'
        END AS vm_name,
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.max_cpu_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS CPU_Usage,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.max_memory_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS MEM_Usage
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active vms only
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 1
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
            GROUP BY a.vm_id
        )
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id IN (
            -- Calculation of Top 5 VMs
            SELECT a.vm_id
            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly a
                INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms b
                    ON ( a.vm_id  = b.vm_id )
            WHERE
                -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                b.cluster_id IN (
                    SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                    WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.datacenter_id =
                        CAST ( '$datacenter_id' AS uuid )
                )
                -- Here we filter by the clusters chosen by the user
                AND b.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS uuid )
            --        CASE $P{P_Cluster_ID}
            --            WHEN '11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111'
            --                THEN b.cluster_id
            --            ELSE CAST ( $P{P_Cluster_ID} AS uuid )
            --        END
                AND a.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                AND a.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
                AND b.history_id IN (
                    SELECT MAX ( g.history_id )
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms g
                    GROUP BY g.vm_id
                )
                -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                -- in the "is_deleted" parameter.
             --   $P!{is_deleted}
            GROUP BY a.vm_id
            -- The vms will be ordered according to the summery of
            -- memory and CPU usage percent.
            --This defines the busiest vms.
            ORDER BY
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.max_memory_usage * a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) /
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) +
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.max_cpu_usage * a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) /
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.minutes_in_status, 0
                    )
                ) ASC
         --   LIMIT 5
        )
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id,
        vm_name, delete_date, history_datetime
) AS a
ORDER BY a.time

panels.title: Five Least Utilized Virtual Machines By Memory(Over Time) (BR12)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying weighted average daily peak of CPU usage for the bottom five busiest virtual machines of a selected cluster and within a given period month.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR12 -This query returns for the top 5 least Utilized vms,
-- the CPU_Usage and MEM_Usage,
-- according to the weighted CPU and Memory Usage peak.

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(a.time),
    COALESCE (
        vm_name,
        MAX ( vm_name ) over ( partition by 1 ),
        ''
    ) AS vm_name,
    CPU_Usage
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id,
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN vm_name
            ELSE
                vm_name
                ||

                ||

                    CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar
                )
                ||
                ')'
        END AS vm_name,
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.cpu_usage_percent,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS CPU_Usage,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.memory_usage_percent,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS MEM_Usage
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id

        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status = 1

        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
            GROUP BY a.vm_id
        )
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id IN (
            -- Calculation of Top 5 VMs
            SELECT a.vm_id
            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples a
                INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms b
                    ON ( a.vm_id  = b.vm_id )
            WHERE
                -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                b.cluster_id IN (
                    SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                    WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.datacenter_id =
                        CAST ( '$datacenter_id' AS uuid )
                )
                -- Here we filter by the clusters chosen by the user
                AND b.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS uuid )
            --        CASE $P{P_Cluster_ID}
            --            WHEN '11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111'
            --                THEN b.cluster_id
            --            ELSE CAST ( $P{P_Cluster_ID} AS uuid )
            --        END
                AND a.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                AND a.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
                AND b.history_id IN (
                    SELECT MAX ( g.history_id )
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms g
                    GROUP BY g.vm_id
                )
                -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                AND
                    CASE
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                      THEN 1=1
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                      THEN delete_date isnull
                    END
            GROUP BY a.vm_id
            -- The vms will be ordered according to the summery of
            -- memory and CPU usage percent.
            --This defines the busiest vms.
            ORDER BY
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.memory_usage_percent * a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) /
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) +
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.cpu_usage_percent * a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) /
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.minutes_in_status, 0
                    )
                ) ASC
            LIMIT 5
        )
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id,
        vm_name, delete_date, history_datetime
) AS a
ORDER BY a.time

-- BR12 -This query returns for the top 5 least Utilized vms,
-- the CPU_Usage and MEM_Usage,
-- according to the weighted CPU and Memory Usage peak.

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(a.time),
    COALESCE (
        vm_name,
        MAX ( vm_name ) over ( partition by 1 ),
        ''
    ) AS vm_name,
    MEM_Usage
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id,
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN vm_name
            ELSE
                vm_name
                ||
                ' (Removed on '
                ||
                CAST (
                    CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar
                )
                ||
                ')'
        END AS vm_name,
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.max_cpu_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS CPU_Usage,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.max_memory_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS MEM_Usage
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active vms only
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 1
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
            GROUP BY a.vm_id
        )
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id IN (
            -- Calculation of Top 5 VMs
            SELECT a.vm_id
            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly a
                INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms b
                    ON ( a.vm_id  = b.vm_id )
            WHERE
                -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                b.cluster_id IN (
                    SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                    WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.datacenter_id =
                        CAST ( '$datacenter_id' AS uuid )
                )
                -- Here we filter by the clusters chosen by the user
                AND b.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS uuid )
            --        CASE $P{P_Cluster_ID}
            --            WHEN '11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111'
            --                THEN b.cluster_id
            --            ELSE CAST ( $P{P_Cluster_ID} AS uuid )
            --        END
                AND a.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                AND a.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
                AND b.history_id IN (
                    SELECT MAX ( g.history_id )
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms g
                    GROUP BY g.vm_id
                )
                -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                -- in the "is_deleted" parameter.
             --   $P!{is_deleted}
            GROUP BY a.vm_id
            -- The vms will be ordered according to the summery of
            -- memory and CPU usage percent.
            --This defines the busiest vms.
            ORDER BY
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.max_memory_usage * a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) /
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) +
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.max_cpu_usage * a.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
                ) /
                SUM (
                    COALESCE (
                        a.minutes_in_status, 0
                    )
                ) ASC
         --   LIMIT 5
        )
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id,
        vm_name, delete_date, history_datetime
) AS a
ORDER BY a.time

panels.title: Five Least Utilized Virtual Machines By CPU(Over Time) (BR12)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters WHERE datacenter_id IN  ('$datacenter_id')

list.name: cluster_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters WHERE datacenter_id IN  ('$datacenter_id')

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT host_name AS __text , host_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts WHERE cluster_id IN ('$cluster_id')

list.name: host_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT host_name AS __text , host_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts WHERE cluster_id IN ('$cluster_id')
